channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A bough of a tree has fallen onto the verge and is obstructing the verge (should anyone be walking along that way). It doesn't look dangerous but it is in the way, and might move in a high wind.., 12th February
item.description:
Grovefield Way, northbound carriageway, just south of the Redding Roundabout

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Failed road repair around roundabout, 12th February
item.description:
The roundabout opposite the Cox’s Meadow Cafe. The road surface is broken in multiple places making it dangerous fir a cycle to negotiate the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Some of the sections of the carriageway that are breaking up have not been marked for repair. Others that have been marked do not cover all the affected area., 12th February
item.description:
General carriageway near Churchdown Library Parton Road and from Meadow Way to 11 Parton Road. The carriageway construction has broken up so a "patch" repair will not last.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches dumped on bank of Wymans Brook, 12th February
item.description:
It appeared that the tree in the adjacent garden had been trimmed and the cut branches had been allowed to fall onto the bank of the brook. There was no-one in the process of clearing them away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Limber Hill, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pavement pot hole , unstable surface, 12th February
item.description:
Andover walk , pavement adjacent to flat 3 , 78 Suffolk Rd building. Have tripped several times on the bricks etc that were laid below tarmac level decades ago! The eroded area is very large and deep. It is also seriously unstable. Dangerous trip hazard for all pedestrians, not just residents. Overall the condition of the whole pavement along Andover walk is extremely poor and left absolutely filthy by supposed street cleaning. Pedestrians can’t use the pavements because they’re so deteriorated . People walk in the road which is extremely dangerous as it’s a notorious motorist rat run plus is littered with pot holes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Suffolk Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 12th February
item.description:
There is some flytipping that has been dumped here over night and it has been there for weeks. The bin men havent taken it so it needs to be removed. Its all wet and starting to smell and mouldy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Sycamore Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 3 very large pot holes, 12th February
item.description:
There is a large pot hole in front of the car park for the building ( 78 Suffolk Rd ) There are 2 large pot holes in the middle of Andover Walk. Basically the entirety of this part of Andover Walk is in dire need of repair and resurfacing. This includes the road surface and pavement ( previously reported) Pedestrians can’t walk down the road safely either on the pavement or in the road and vehicles are swerving to avoid pot holes that may cause damage to their vehicles. It is all so dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Walk, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pothole around the grate you fixed a week ago has already disintegrated because of standing water, 13th February
item.description:
The pothole you fixed around the grate has already disintegrated. The gully is blocked so every time it rains the tarmac fix is in standing water and has now come away and added to the rest of the drain sludge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 225, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
